==Events==
* [[481]] &ndash; [[Vandals|Vandal]] king [[Huneric]] organises a conference between [[Catholicism|Catholic]] and [[Arianism|Arian]] bishops at [[Carthage]].
*[[1327]] &ndash; Teenaged [[Edward III of England|Edward III]] is [[coronation|crowned]] King of England, but the country is ruled by his mother [[Isabella of France|Queen Isabella]] and her lover [[Roger Mortimer, 1st Earl of March|Roger Mortimer]].
*[[1329]] &ndash; King [[John of Bohemia]] [[Siege of Medvėgalis|captures Medvėgalis]], an important fortress of the pagan [[Grand Duchy of Lithuania]], and baptizes 6,000 of its defenders
*[[1411]] &ndash; The [[Peace of Thorn (1411)|First Peace of Thorn]] is signed in [[Toruń|Thorn]], [[Monastic State of the Teutonic Knights]] (Prussia).
*[[1662]] &ndash; The Chinese general [[Koxinga]] seizes the island of [[Taiwan]] after a [[Siege of Fort Zeelandia|nine-month siege]].
*[[1713]] &ndash; The ''Kalabalik'' or ''[[Skirmish at Bender|Tumult in Bendery]]'' results from the [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman]] [[sultan]]'s order that his unwelcome guest, King [[Charles XII of Sweden]], be seized.
*[[1790]] &ndash; In [[New York City]], the [[Supreme Court of the United States]] convenes for the first time.
*[[1793]] &ndash; [[French Revolutionary Wars]]: France declares war on the United Kingdom and the Netherlands.
*[[1796]] &ndash; The capital of [[Upper Canada]] is moved from [[Niagara, Ontario|Newark]] to [[Toronto|York]].
*[[1814]] &ndash; [[Mayon Volcano]] in the [[Philippines]] erupts, killing around 1,200 people, the most devastating eruption of the volcano.
*[[1835]] &ndash; [[Slavery]] is [[Abolitionism|abolished]] in [[Mauritius]].
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Texas]] secedes from the United States.
*[[1865]] &ndash; President [[Abraham Lincoln]] signs the [[Thirteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution]].
*[[1876]] &ndash; A murder conviction effectively forces the violent [[Pennsylvania]]n [[Irish people|Irish]] anti-owner coal miners, the "[[Molly Maguires]]", to disband.
*[[1884]] &ndash; The first volume (''A'' to ''Ant'') of the ''[[Oxford English Dictionary]]'' is published.
*[[1893]] &ndash; [[Thomas A. Edison]] finishes construction of the first [[film|motion picture]] studio, the [[Edison's Black Maria|Black Maria]] in [[West Orange, New Jersey]].
*[[1897]] &ndash; [[Shinhan Bank]], the oldest [[List of Banks in South Korea|bank in South Korea]], opens in [[Seoul]].
*[[1908]] &ndash; King [[Carlos I of Portugal]] and his son, Prince [[Luís Filipe, Duke of Braganza|Luis Filipe]], are killed in [[Terreiro do Paco]], [[Lisbon]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; Russia adopts the [[Gregorian Calendar]].
*[[1920]] &ndash; The [[Royal Canadian Mounted Police]] begins operations.
*[[1924]] &ndash; The United Kingdom recognizes the [[Soviet Union|USSR]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Josef Terboven]], [[Reichskommissar]] of [[Occupation of Norway by Nazi Germany|German-occupied Norway]], appoints [[Vidkun Quisling]] the [[Prime Minister of Norway|Minister President]] of the [[Quisling regime|National Government]].
*  1942   &ndash; World War II: U.S. Navy conducts [[Marshalls-Gilberts raids]], the first offensive action by the United States against Japanese forces in the [[Pacific Ocean theater of World War II|Pacific Theater]].
*  1942   &ndash; [[Voice of America]], the official external radio and television service of the [[Federal government of the United States|United States government]], begins broadcasting with programs aimed at areas controlled by the [[Axis powers]].
*[[1946]] &ndash; [[Trygve Lie]] of Norway is picked to be the first [[United Nations Secretary General]].
*  1946   &ndash; The [[National Assembly of Hungary|Parliament of Hungary]] abolishes the monarchy after nine centuries, and proclaims the [[Republic of Hungary (1946–49)|Hungarian Republic]].
*[[1953]] &ndash; [[North Sea flood of 1953]] (Dutch, Watersnoodramp, literally "flood disaster") was a major flood caused by a heavy storm, that occurred on the night of Saturday, 31 January 1953 and morning of Sunday, 1 February 1953. The floods struck the Netherlands, Belgium, England and Scotland. 
*[[1957]] &ndash; [[Felix Wankel]]'s first working prototype (DKM 54) of the [[Wankel engine]] runs at the [[NSU Motorenwerke AG|NSU]] research and development department ''Versuchsabteilung TX'' in Germany
*[[1960]] &ndash; Four black students stage the first of the [[Greensboro sit-ins]] at a lunch counter in [[Greensboro, North Carolina]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[The Beatles]] have their first number one hit in the United States with [[I Want to Hold Your Hand]]
*[[1965]] &ndash; The Hamilton River in [[Labrador]], Canada is renamed the [[Churchill River (Atlantic)|Churchill River]] in honour of [[Winston Churchill]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: The execution of [[Viet Cong]] officer [[Nguyen Van Lem]] by [[South Vietnam]]ese National Police Chief [[Nguyen Ngoc Loan]] is videotaped and photographed by [[Eddie Adams (photographer)|Eddie Adams]]. This image helped build [[opposition to the Vietnam War]].
*  1968   &ndash; Canada's three military services, the [[Royal Canadian Navy]], the [[Canadian Army]] and the [[Royal Canadian Air Force]], are unified into the [[Canadian Forces]].
*  1968   &ndash; The [[New York Central Railroad]] and the [[Pennsylvania Railroad]] are merged to form [[Penn Central Transportation]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Kuala Lumpur]] becomes a city by a royal charter granted by the [[Yang di-Pertuan Agong]] of [[Malaysia]].
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[Joelma fire|A fire]] in the 25-story [[Joelma Building]] in [[Sao Paulo]], [[Brazil]] kills 189 and injures 293.
*  1974   &ndash; [[Kuala Lumpur]] is declared a [[Federal Territory (Malaysia)|Federal Territory]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; Director [[Roman Polanski]] skips [[bail]] and flees the United States to France after pleading guilty to charges of having sex with a 13-year-old girl.
*[[1979]] &ndash; Convicted bank robber [[Patty Hearst]] is released from prison after her sentence is commuted by [[President of the United States|President]] [[Jimmy Carter]].
*  1979   &ndash; The [[Ayatollah]] [[Ruhollah Khomeini]] returns to [[Tehran]], [[Iran]] after nearly 15 years of exile.
*[[1982]] &ndash; [[Senegal]] and [[the Gambia]] form a loose confederation known as [[Sénégambia Confederation|Senegambia]].
*[[1989]] &ndash; The Western Australian towns of Kalgoorlie and Boulder amalgamate to form the [[Kalgoorlie, Western Australia|City of Kalgoorlie-Boulder]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Humanitas publishing house]] is founded in [[Bucharest]], shortly after the [[Romanian Revolution of 1989|Romanian Revolution]], by the philosopher [[Gabriel Liiceanu]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; A runway collision between [[USAir Flight 1493]] and [[USAir Flight 1493|SkyWest Flight 5569]] at [[Los Angeles International Airport]] results in the deaths of 34 people, and injuries to 30 others.
*[[1992]] &ndash; The Chief Judicial Magistrate of [[Bhopal]] court declares [[Warren Anderson (chairman)|Warren Anderson]], ex-[[Chief executive officer|CEO]] of [[Union Carbide]], a fugitive under Indian law for failing to appear in the [[Bhopal Disaster]] case.
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[Gary Bettman]] becomes the NHL's first [[NHL Commissioner|commissioner]]
*[[1994]] &ndash; Punk rock band [[Green Day]] releases their album ''[[Dookie]]'', which would eventually sell over 20 million copies worldwide.
*[[1996]] &ndash; The [[Communications Decency Act]] is passed by the [[Congress of the United States|U.S. Congress]].
*[[1998]] &ndash; Rear Admiral [[Lillian E. Fishburne]] becomes the first female African American to be promoted to rear admiral.
*[[2001]] &ndash; [[Putrajaya]], the Malaysian administrative city, is declared a [[Federal Territories (Malaysia)|Federal Territory]].
*[[2002]] &ndash; [[Daniel Pearl]], American journalist and [[South Asia]] Bureau Chief of the [[Wall Street Journal]], kidnapped January 23, 2002, is beheaded and mutilated by his captors.
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[Space Shuttle Columbia disaster|Space Shuttle ''Columbia'']] on mission [[STS-107]] disintegrates during reentry into the Earth's atmosphere, killing all seven astronauts aboard.
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[Incidents during the Hajj#Failures in crowd control|251 people are trampled to death and 244 injured]] in a stampede at the [[Hajj]] pilgrimage in [[Saudi Arabia]].
*  2004   &ndash; [[Janet Jackson]]'s [[Super Bowl XXXVIII halftime show controversy|breast is exposed]] during the half-time show of [[Super Bowl XXXVIII]], resulting in US broadcasters adopting a stronger adherence to [[Federal Communications Commission]] censorship guidelines.
*[[2005]] &ndash; King [[Gyanendra of Nepal]] carries out a [[coup d'état]] to capture the democracy, becoming [[Chairman]] of the Councils of ministers.
* [[2013]] &ndash; [[The Shard]], the [[List of tallest buildings in the European Union|tallest building in the European Union]], is opened to the public.
